definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Not being able to stand his ingratiation , I helplessly agreed to his request.
sentences.chinese: 嚅囁我經不住他的死纏硬泡，無奈地答應了他的請求。

sentences.english: His position doesn't stand up to detailed examination.
sentences.chinese: 他的立場經不住嚴格檢查。

sentences.english: Cannot stand up to the years rolling like a stream, and cannot escape the youth.
sentences.chinese: 經不住似水流年，逃不過此間少年。

sentences.english: That chair won't support a heavy person.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子經不住一個胖人。

sentences.english: That ice is too thin to stand on.
He can't bear being laughed at.
The paint won't stand up to bad weather, it's too cheap.
sentences.chinese: 這種塗料經不住壞天氣，因爲它太便宜了。

sentences.english: The body cannot tolerate such large amounts of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 身體經不住那麼大劑量的放射線。

sentences.english: Silks packed in cartons are not quite sea-worthy.
sentences.chinese: 用這種方法包裝絲綢經不住海運。
